title: Accidental skin purchase intended as gift
body: I accidentally purchased Pool Party Taric for myself, when intending to gift it to someone. While this was for the purpose of terrorizing meta players with pool party fiora/taric bot combo (fiora spammer here), I hope Riot will see passed my many faults in life, and allow me to refund this. I have not used the skin yet. Is there any way to convert this purchase to a gift, or refund the RP so I can directly purchase it as a gift this time?

replies.body:
Riot strictly holds to their [refund policy](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751864-Content-Refund-FAQ); they want you to be absolutely sure you have selected the intended content before you purchase it as you are only given 3 refund tokens. The Gifting Center is in a completely different area from the Store where you buy things for yourself, and has several extra steps and a different layout, so it's nearly impossible to make this mistake.

While you're very likely out of luck, you can try asking them by submitting a [Support Ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

Saying it's impossible because it doesn't occur to me at 1 in the morning that it aint like Steam - which puts gift selection after merchandise selection, instead of vice versa - is unreasonable. It doesn't matter which order it's in. It's equally likely to happen. And given they changed up the store recently, it makes it even more likely.

I checked support tickets, but no categories fit. That's why I came here. If they want to adhere to their oddly restrictive refund policy, that's fine. But there was no harm in checking in the one place that doesn't require a ream of categories to fill in, that ultimately don't match the request. I might try an "other" ticket category though. But it doesn't sound like it's worth it.
